meanings.definition: A falsely attributed or spurious writing.
meanings.sent1: The professor explained that the ancient scroll was a pseudepigraphon, not actually written by the famous historian.
meanings.sent2: The library contained a pseudepigraphon, a book mistakenly believed to be authored by Shakespeare.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a pseudepigraphon in the old bookstore, claiming to be a lost work of a famous poet.
meanings.sent4: The internet is full of pseudepigrapha, where anyone can claim to be a renowned author.
meanings.sent5: In the world of literature, a pseudepigraphon can cause confusion about the true origins of a text.

meanings.definition: A work falsely ascribed to a particular author.
meanings.sent1: The rare manuscript turned out to be a pseudepigraphon, mistakenly linked to a well-known writer.
meanings.sent2: Scholars debated the authenticity of the pseudepigraphon, unsure if it truly belonged to the famous playwright.
meanings.sent3: The auction house unknowingly sold a pseudepigraphon, thinking it was an original piece by a renowned artist.
meanings.sent4: The discovery of a pseudepigraphon in the archives raised questions about the authorship of historical documents.
meanings.sent5: Authors sometimes create a pseudepigraphon to explore different writing styles under a different name.
